alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Keya Paha; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 10:17PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Cherry, eastern Hooker, western Brown, northern Logan, northeastern McPherson, northwestern Blaine, Thomas and western Keya Paha Counties through 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/... At 1017 PM CDT/917 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lakeview to 7 miles south of Merritt Reservoir to 6 miles northwest of Seneca to 9 miles northwest of Tryon. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Merritt Reservoir around 1020 PM CDT. Valentine National Wildlife Refuge around 1025 PM CDT. Brownlee around 1035 PM CDT. Halsey and Norden around 1055 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Highway 83 crossing The Dismal River, Wood Lake, Moon Lake, North River Trail, Sparks, Willow Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Long Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River, Smith Falls State Park and Schlagel Creek State Wildlife Management Area. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 177 and 238. Highway 2 between mile markers 186 and 228. Highway 92 between mile markers 190 and 198, and between mile markers 200 and 203. Highway 97 between mile markers 32 and 64, and between mile markers 101 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 121 and 222. Highway 12 between mile markers 1 and 39, and between mile markers 41 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Keya Paha; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
